key_points: At least five civilians killed in an explosion outside the Eid Gah Mosque in Kabul during a memorial service.
Four other people were wounded in the attack targeting the mother's memorial service of Taliban spokesman Zabihullah Mujahid.
This is the first attack in Kabul since late August, when an ISIS-K suicide bomber targeted American evacuation efforts.
An Italian-funded emergency hospital in Kabul received four wounded individuals from the blast.
Taliban fighters were not harmed, and three suspects have been arrested following the explosion.
The explosion underscores the growing security challenges faced by the Taliban.
No group has claimed responsibility for the attack, but ISIL-affiliated fighters' attacks have increased since the Taliban takeover.
The explosion is seen as undermining the Taliban's claim of enhanced security in Afghanistan.
ISKP has been increasing its attacks against the Taliban and expanding its presence closer to Kabul.
The attack reflects the broader context of security and economic challenges facing Afghanistan under Taliban rule.
spokespersons: Marco Puntin (Country Director in Afghanistan for Emergency)
